fi.ana.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.ana.logic.Game

  • public class Game
extends Object
    Smushes all the logic together, starts games and proceeds to the next turn.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkIfInhabitedCoordinate(int x, int y)
      Checks if the specified location is currently inhabited by a player or a monster.
      boolean checkIfOnGoal()
      Checks if the player character is on the goal.
      boolean checkIfPassableCoordinate(int x, int y)
      Checks if the specified position is a valid position for moving into.
      void checkMonsterAggro()
      Checks if the player is inside aggro range of any monster, and activates their pathfinding if so.
      void game1()
      Starts game1, setting all values back to default game1-values and re-randomising monster locations.
      void game2()
      Starts game2, setting all values back to default game2-values and re-randomising monster locations.
      void game3()
      Starts game3, setting all values back to default game3-values and re-randomising monster locations.
      Goal getGoal()
      Returns the Goal-object of the game.
      List<Item> getItems()
      Returns a list of items currently in the game.
      GameMap getMap()
      Returns the GameMap object currently used to store the game's map.
      List<Monster> getMonsters()
      Returns a list of monsters currently in the game.
      PlayerCharacter getPlayer()
      Returns the PlayerCharacter object associated with the player.
      int getTurnCount()
      Returns how many turns have passed.
      boolean isPositionVisible(int x, int y)
      Checks if the specified position should be visible to the player.
      void proceed(int x, int y)
      Moves the game ahead one turn and moves the player.
      void randomGame()
      Starts a random game, setting all values back to default random game -values and re-randomising monster locations.
      boolean resolveCombat(int x, int y)
      Resolves what happens in "combat" between the player and a monster in the specified coordinates.
      void resolveStackedItemAndPlayer()
      Calls the interact()-method of any items stacked with the player.
      boolean resolveStackedMonsterAndPlayer()
      Calls the resolveCombat method on the player's coordinates.
      void spawnEntitiesIfValidTurn()
      Spawns a new monster and/or healthpack if correct turn, and if there are not too many.
      void start()
      Starts the game UI.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the game UI.

      • proceed

        public void proceed(int x,
                    int y)
        Moves the game ahead one turn and moves the player.
        Parameters:
        x - amount of spaces the player should move on the x-axis.
        y - amount of spaces the player should move on the y-axis.

      • getPlayer

        public PlayerCharacter getPlayer()
        Returns the PlayerCharacter object associated with the player.
        Returns:
        PlayerCharacter object.

      • getMap

        public GameMap getMap()
        Returns the GameMap object currently used to store the game's map.
        Returns:
        a GameMap object.

      • getTurnCount

        public int getTurnCount()
        Returns how many turns have passed.
        Returns:
        turn count.

      • isPositionVisible

        public boolean isPositionVisible(int x,
                                 int y)
        Checks if the specified position should be visible to the player.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate.
        y - y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        true if visible, false if not.

      • getItems

        public List<Item> getItems()
        Returns a list of items currently in the game.
        Returns:
        A list of Item-objects.

      • getMonsters

        public List<Monster> getMonsters()
        Returns a list of monsters currently in the game.
        Returns:
        A list of Monster-objects.

      • getGoal

        public Goal getGoal()
        Returns the Goal-object of the game.
        Returns:
        A Goal-object.

      • game1

        public void game1()
        Starts game1, setting all values back to default game1-values and re-randomising monster locations.

      • game2

        public void game2()
        Starts game2, setting all values back to default game2-values and re-randomising monster locations.

      • game3

        public void game3()
        Starts game3, setting all values back to default game3-values and re-randomising monster locations.

      • randomGame

        public void randomGame()
        Starts a random game, setting all values back to default random game -values and re-randomising monster locations. The map will be randomised.

      • checkIfPassableCoordinate

        public boolean checkIfPassableCoordinate(int x,
                                         int y)
        Checks if the specified position is a valid position for moving into.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate.
        y - y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        true if passable, false if not.

      • checkIfInhabitedCoordinate

        public boolean checkIfInhabitedCoordinate(int x,
                                          int y)
        Checks if the specified location is currently inhabited by a player or a monster.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate.
        y - y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        true if inhabited, false if not.

      • resolveCombat

        public boolean resolveCombat(int x,
                             int y)
        Resolves what happens in "combat" between the player and a monster in the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of monster to combat.
        y - y-coordinate of monster to combat.
        Returns:
        true if the player survives, false if not.

      • resolveStackedMonsterAndPlayer

        public boolean resolveStackedMonsterAndPlayer()
        Calls the resolveCombat method on the player's coordinates.
        Returns:
        true if the player survives, false if not.

      • resolveStackedItemAndPlayer

        public void resolveStackedItemAndPlayer()
        Calls the interact()-method of any items stacked with the player.

      • checkIfOnGoal

        public boolean checkIfOnGoal()
        Checks if the player character is on the goal.
        Returns:
        true if the player is on the goal, fals if not.

      • checkMonsterAggro

        public void checkMonsterAggro()
        Checks if the player is inside aggro range of any monster, and activates their pathfinding if so.

      • spawnEntitiesIfValidTurn

        public void spawnEntitiesIfValidTurn()
        Spawns a new monster and/or healthpack if correct turn, and if there are not too many.
